synthesized_claims.statement: Warburg metabolism (high glycolysis) is causally linked to immune evasion via gate-jamming.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Glycolytic flux increases HK-II binding to VDAC1, stabilizing the gate-jammed state and suppressing mtDNA leak.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Metabolically active tumors with low gate-jamming or immune-hot phenotypes, or non-glycolytic tumors with high gate-jamming.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Warburg metabolism (high glycolysis) is causally linked to immune evasion via gate-jamming.

synthesized_claims.statement: Gate-jamming (high f_HKII/f_BclxL/Chol/CL) predicts immune-cold tumors by blocking VDAC1 oligomerization and mtDNA-cGAS-STING.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: HKII/BclxL/Chol stabilize closed VDAC1 conformations, preventing Bax/Bak-induced oligomers that leak mtDNA to activate innate immunity.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Biopsies showing high f_HKII/Chol-CL in immune-hot (high T-cell/PDL1) tumors.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Gate-jamming (high f_HKII/f_BclxL/Chol/CL) predicts immune-cold tumors by blocking VDAC1 oligomerization and mtDNA-cGAS-STING.

synthesized_claims.statement: Pharmacological gate-restoration (HK-II displacement + Bcl-xL inhibition) will convert immune-cold tumors to immune-hot and synergize with checkpoint inhibitors.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Forced VDAC1 oligomerization → mtDNA leak → cGAS-STING activation → T-cell infiltration; checkpoint inhibitors amplify existing immune responses.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Gate-restoration failing to increase cGAS-STING activity or T-cell infiltration in immune-cold tumors, or lack of synergy with checkpoint inhibitors.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Pharmacological gate-restoration (HK-II displacement + Bcl-xL inhibition) will convert immune-cold tumors to immune-hot and synergize with checkpoint inhibitors.

synthesized_claims.statement: f_HKII occupancy or Chol/CL ratio in tumor biopsies can predict immunotherapy response.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: High gate-jamming metrics correlate with suppressed cGAS-STING and poor checkpoint inhibitor efficacy.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Retrospective/prospective studies showing no correlation between gate-jamming metrics and immunotherapy response.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: f_HKII occupancy or Chol/CL ratio in tumor biopsies can predict immunotherapy response.

synthesized_claims.statement: Gate-restoration + checkpoint inhibitors synergize specifically in immune-cold tumors, resolving PD1/PDL1 paradox.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Gate-drugs provide initial cGAS-STING "visibility" signal absent in jammed/cold tumors, amplifying PD1 blockade effects.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Clinical trials showing no added benefit of combo vs checkpoint alone in cold tumors.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Gate-restoration + checkpoint inhibitors synergize specifically in immune-cold tumors, resolving PD1/PDL1 paradox.

synthesized_claims.statement: High VDAC1 occupancy by Hexokinase-II (f_HKII) and/or a high membrane Chol/CL ratio in tumor biopsies are strong predictive biomarkers for primary resistance to PD-1/PD-L1 checkpoint inhibitors.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: These gate-jamming conditions prevent VDAC1 oligomerization, blocking the release of mitochondrial dsDNA required to activate the cGAS-STING pathway, thus rendering the tumor immunologically "invisible."
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: A multi-center patient cohort study showing no significant correlation between pre-treatment f_HKII or Chol/CL levels and lack of response to anti-PD-1 therapy.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: High VDAC1 occupancy by Hexokinase-II (f_HKII) and/or a high membrane Chol/CL ratio in tumor biopsies are strong predictive biomarkers for primary resistance to PD-1/PD-L1 checkpoint inhibitors.

synthesized_claims.statement: Pharmacological VDAC1 gate-restoration will synergize with checkpoint inhibitors, primarily by converting non-responders into responders.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Gate-restoring drugs force VDAC1 oligomerization and mtDNA release, initiating cGAS-STING signaling that recruits T-cells to the tumor, creating the inflammatory context required for a checkpoint inhibitor to function effectively.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Preclinical studies in syngeneic immune-cold mouse tumor models where combination therapy with a gate-restoring drug and anti-PD-1 fails to show efficacy greater than the sum of the individual agents.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Pharmacological VDAC1 gate-restoration will synergize with checkpoint inhibitors, primarily by converting non-responders into responders.
